title: Small Farm Harvests that earn $4000/week on 1/2 Acre of Land

tasks.task: Work in a small-scale vegetable farm producing high-value crops
subtasks: Farmers tend to grafted tomato plants.
Prune tomato plants to promote yield and growth.
Use drip irrigation for tomato plants.
Graft rootstocks to tomato varieties for increased productivity.
Grow multiple crops in greenhouses, such as cucumbers, with similar intensive care.
Maintain high yields of seasonal crops like carrots, arugula, peppers, etc., through frequent harvesting.
Harvest and package salad greens (e.g., lettuce, arugula) for market.
Grow microgreens such as pea shoots and sunflower shoots for specialized markets.
Manage herb gardens, including parsley, cilantro, and dill, for restaurant and market sales.
Employ cold storage for salad greens, herbs, and root vegetables to extend selling periods.
Adapt pricing and sales strategies, such as bulk discounts and premium market stalls, to maximize revenue.
Utilize multi-cropping techniques to diversify produce offerings and appeal to different customer segments.
Plant and manage winter crops, such as carrots and storage crops, for fall and early winter harvest.
Address challenges like flea beetles and bolting in herb crops to maintain plant health.
